page.title: 01Scunthorpe. Overview.
page.content: Our Domesday block stretches from the River Trent in the West, to the top edge of the escarpment leading into the Borough of Scunthorpe, in the East. The Western edge is bordered by the villages of Gunness and Burringham. Travelling East, you pass through rich, flat farmland. This is almost bisected by the M181 which joins the area to the national Motorway network. The eastern edge is bordered by steadily expanding, modern estates. Keadby Bridge and the 4km stretch of railway running West to East, were, historically, of major importance in the development of Scunthorpe as an industrial town.
